description.narrative: "Responsible business conduct in East Africa: Strengthening a multi-stakeholder approach to the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights in Ethiopia and Uganda" is a two-year project with an aim to strengthen multi-stakeholder approaches to the implementation and monitoring of the UNGPs in Uganda and Ethiopia through development of CSO capacity and establish a good practice model for meaningful participation of local right-holders and CSOs in UNGP implementation and monitoring.

title.narrative: Documentation of institutionalised steps, including increased CSO capacity and engagement in policy initiatives and practices to develop and implement the UNGPs in Uganda and Ethiopia.

- Multi-stakeholder engagement has enabled and contributes to practical implementation of UNGPs in accordance with normative standards to roll-out and monitoring of activities in Uganda. - Multi-stakeholder dialogue contributes to UNGP implementation in policy and practices in Ethiopia.
